p: Transhumance migration has long been proven to be effective not only in Southern Africa but also in other parts of the world, such as Ethiopia, Kenya, Tanzania, India, Bangladesh and the Sahel (Anderson et al. 2007; Rahmato 1991). Anderson et al. ( 2007) demonstrate that drought migration requires the movement of livestock and often entire families.
